name: Inn New York City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even after reading all the positive reviews, Inn New York City exceeded our expectations. What a unique and comforting spot within short walking distance to The Met, Central Park and access to the Subway.
reviews.title: Romantic Hideaway in the Big City

likes.liked: — Comfort, Spa Amenities and Location & Personal Service
likes.disliked: — I can't even think of any thing to change

reviews.title: A "home away from home" on a wonderful honeymoon in NYC
reviews.text: We stayed in the Spa Suite and completely enjoyed the big tub and sauna and fabulous rain shower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Suite was uniquely decorated with all the comforts anyone might require.. Miss Ruth was a charming host and even taught me ( a Southerner) to put on my winter scarf New York style!
reviews.title: Perfect Inn New York

reviews.text: The yummy treats in the kitchenette were quite delicious and we especially enjoyed the quiche with cheddar cheese and the wonderful fresh fruit.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am someone who needs peace and quiet to enjoy a vacation. Too many people stress me out. This wonderful Boutique Hotel allowed me to enjoy the energy and excitement of the big city knowing that a quiet space was just steps away. We also found that we could spend just a little $$$ at one of the amazing gourmet food stores just up Broadway (Fairway & Zabar's) to have a delicious and quiet meal.. Inn New York City kitchenette had all that we needed to utilize the markets.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Everything others have written is correct, but from our perspective, here is another angle. If you are wanting a 5 star big bustling hotel with concierge, valet, health spa, pools, entertainment, nightclubs, shops on premises, people watching, restaurants and noise, this is not for you at all.
reviews.title: Quite Unique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If on the other hand, you want to experience 4 rooms only, no noise and with great shops, restaurants and everything NY has to offer, virtually within walking distance and also where the locals go, this could be right up your street. Excellent housekeeping, unobtrusive, helpful when asked and always on call if needed.
reviews.title: I just loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extraordinary place for people who want and expect something different. Stayed in the Opera suite with my wife from the 3rd to the 7th August which although slightly on the dark side, has a private terrace which made it for us and is virtually unheard of in any NY Hotels. It's not for everyone, it's for people who demand class from another era without all the hoi-poloi that usually is associated from a top snotty hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay at the Inn New York City!

likes.liked: — The relaxed romantic feel, closeness to the city, size of accomodations, all the little extras

reviews.text: We will definately return when next in the area. Thx Elyn and Ruth. P&F.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay @ the Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a little piece of peace in New York !!
reviews.title: The Place to Stay!

likes.liked: — The care and concern of the owners.

reviews.title: okay hotel
reviews.text: hotel was decent, would recommend it to others

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Inn New York City is a unique experience and one that should not be missed. The accommodations in a converted townhouse are luxurious, the woodwork is beautiful and functional, and the amenities and staff exceptionally thoughtful. It would be the perfect place for a honeymoon or other romantic trip. This is not a good place for small children, and one must be able to climb stairs, as there are no elevators. If you need a break from standard hotel layout and furnishings, you will love the Inn. The location is on the upper east side, so it is not near the theater district, but it is a short walk to Lincoln center, central park, etc. We had no problem getting taxis in the neighborhood. There is no identifying sign outside, only the address on a small marquee over the front stoop. If you catch a taxi to get there, be sure to tell the driver that the block is between Broadway and West End.
reviews.title: Wonderfully Different

reviews.text: What a wonderful stay we had at the Inn New York City, it was everything you read here at Trip Advisor and more.
reviews.title: A Sanctuary!

likes.liked: — Gleaming woods, brass & glass antiques, luxury linens and top notch service.
likes.disliked: — Figuring out the keys and locks (3 doors!)

reviews.title: As expected
reviews.text: We were a party of 4, 2 women and 2 teenage girls booked in the Library Suite for 5 nights, August 19th - 24th.

reviews.title: Highest level of customer service from Ruth and Elyn
reviews.text: The Library Suite is on the top floor of the Inn, 2 interior flights up... from the moment we walked in the front door we felt like we were home. Elyn showed us up to our suite giving us a tour as we went. All the comforts of home abound in this gorgeous apartment with full kitchen, living room, beautiful dining area and charming bedroom with sun streaming in from the leaded glass skylights ~ We all loved it immediately!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the inn for Christmas 2008. We had the Piano Suite which is on the ground floor.
reviews.title: Just as we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading many reviews we thought we would give this place a go and we were not disapointed.
reviews.title: super alternative to a hotel

likes.liked: — feeling as though you're in a home, and not in a standard hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before we arrived we asked Ruth if she would get us a Christmas tree, and indeed when we arrived it was in our suite waiting for us, Ruth also gave us a basket of festive decorations for us to decorate the tree.
reviews.title: It's Still Heaven On Earth

reviews.text: The Suite was very clean and so so lovely . Huge fire place, stained glass ceiling, full kitchen ( with lots of food & drink items at no extra charge) his and hers dressing robes and of course the baby grand piano. Infact it had everything and more you could want.
reviews.title: Fantastic time at the Inn New York City

reviews.text: The bathroom is quite small but very well equiped with everything you need.
reviews.title: A very nice find

aka: Inn New York City Hotel New York City
description: Inn New York City, a restored 19th century townhouse hotel on the upper west side, is a destination in itself. It is the ultimate in romance and exclusivity or just a great place to bring the family. Behind our unassuming and discreet façade are four sumptuous suites.The dramatic Opera Suite on the Parlor floor has a baby grand piano, a working fireplace, a stained glass ceiling and a quiet balcony overlooking the serene garden.Stay in the Spa Suite and indulge in your own personal spa with a Jacuzzi-for-two, sauna, rain shower and a king-size platform bed. In the Vermont Suite you will delight in our country style duplex tucked away with its own private entrance and a Victorian spiral staircase to the bedroom.The Library Suite is the most spacious with 14' pocket doors that can convert the living room to a 2nd bedroom. The suite has a working fireplace with an antique mantle, leaded-glass skylights, and a fine literary collection in its floor to ceiling bookcases.Each suite has a fully equipped kitchen stocked with complimentary wine, fruit basket, breakfast treats, snacks and beverages. 24 hour concierge, daily housekeeping and laundry services are provided with a judicious blend of presence and privacy.
